title: Britain’s buses will be driven over a cliff if they’re run like the railways
text:
It’s a rarity for a prime minister to focus on buses as a key policy priority. But Boris Johnson’s pledge in Manchester recently to improve Britain’s bus network finally gives our most used public transport mode the prominence it deserves.

From his time as mayor of London, Mr Johnson knows how buses are a vital part of the UK’s infrastructure. Passengers generate £64bn of economic output annually in the UK and our bus manufacturing sector is a world leader. Every day, buses take two million people to work and a million more to school or college.
